articles.author: Yilei Sun
articles.title: RPT-UPDATE 2-China says no significant cut in new energy vehicle subsidies in 2020
articles.description: China will not make significant cuts to subsidies for new energy vehicles (NEV) this year, signalling that its policy will remain relatively stable, state media quoted the country's industry ministry as saying on Saturday.
articles.content:
(Repeats story published on Saturday, with no change to text) 
By Yilei Sun and Brenda Goh 
BEIJING/SHANGHAI, Jan 11 (Reuters) - China will not make significant cuts to subsidies for new energy vehicles (NEV) this year, signalling that its policy will remai… [+2065 chars]

articles.author: Lizbeth Diaz
articles.title: Mexican president vows justice in visit to town scarred by massacre
articles.description: Mexico's president pledged on Sunday that those behind a massacre that killed nine members of a U.S.-Mexican family of Mormon origin will be punished and that the truth surrounding the crime will eventually come out.
articles.content:
LA MORA (Reuters) - Mexico’s president pledged on Sunday that those behind a massacre that killed nine members of a U.S.-Mexican family of Mormon origin will be punished and that the truth surrounding the crime will eventually come out.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Iran issues more visas to Canadian team probing crash and helping families
articles.description: Iran has issued eight more visas to a team of Canadian officials following a fatal plane crash near Tehran and most members of the group should be in Tehran on Monday, Canadian Foreign Minister Francois-Philippe Champagne said on Sunday.
articles.content:
OTTAWA (Reuters) - Iran has issued eight more visas to a team of Canadian officials following a fatal plane crash near Tehran and most members of the group should be in Tehran on Monday, Canadian Foreign Minister Francois-Philippe Champagne said on Sunday.

articles.title: New Zealand volcano death toll rises to 18 after another person dies in Australian hospital
articles.description: The death toll from last month's volcanic eruption in New Zealand rose to 18 as one of the injured died in a hospital in Australia, police said on Monday, while two remain missing and are presumed dead.
articles.content:
WELLINGTON (Reuters) - The death toll from last month’s volcanic eruption in New Zealand rose to 18 as one of the injured died in a hospital in Australia, police said on Monday, while two remain missing and are presumed dead.
